name: LoveBeat
description: LoveBeat is a free-to-play casual rhythm game that features the various indie songs and dance moves. Steal the show by joining LoveBeat dance party where it’s full of lovable people all over the world!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP Processor: Pentium4 3.0GHz Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: GeForce 6600 GT, Radeon X1600 Pro DirectX: Version 9.0c Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 20 GB available space Sound Card: DirectX Compatible
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: Core 2 Duo 6300 Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: GeForce 7600 GT, Radeon X1800 DirectX: Version 9.0c Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 20 GB available space Sound Card: DirectX Compatible

reviews.review_text: I Highly Recommend this game, If ur into rhythm, action, music, and some really weird dance moves, Making new friends or even a relationship. Monthly Updates with new items for all kinds of things, and new events every update.  I find this game Very Cute, Attractive and also has a Lovely Community. So I recommend u to download it and give it a try. (Leveling up takes awhile) (Little Hard for the beginniers when starting, so make sure to practice off with 1-2 stars, 60-90 BPM)
Very good game! I addicted this and I play everyday.. haha

Short Version: It's just a silly rhythm game from Korea where you can dress up as a cat, have a fox tail or nine, and dance with strangers to a very High School Musical vibe. It's a fine little game. Everyone is judging it rather harshly for being a little too foreign.   As a rhythm game it is actually fairly good. The important thing to know is that when it shows Left and Down in a single block it doesn't mean push them at the same time but instead in that order as half notes. The complaints about clothing not being permanent is a trivial one as you get the currency to 'rent' these both by events and daily logins.. there are also clothes you can rent with the in game currency they toss at you after each match.   Throw in the social aspect of playing with random strangers from all over the world (who seem to average between 12 and 20) and some of the strange game modes that let you couple up regardless of gender and dance together ending in an awkward kiss or the mode that pairs up male and female avatars to 'propose' ending with each player picking one of the males or females and adding extra in game currency and becoming friends if you match up with each other.
Get Back The 100%dc

The graphics aren't high quality but I like the style of them. 3 avatar types per gender. (Careful, you can not change gender once selected) The wardrobe is limited and you have to pay more to actually keep the clothing you get for your character. A lot of which costs cash, not the 'in game free currency'. I do like that there is a wide variety of songs in various languages and music genres. It's nice to hear music you have have never been exposed to before. I haven't seen other people mention this in the reviews but this game constantly drops connection for me (And a few other people I know who play). It usually happens in the middle of playing a song which can get frustrating. None of my other games do this. It is just this game. This is the biggest concern for me as far as game quality. If I want to play a game, I want to play it, not keep reloading it because it's dropped connection on me.  Overall I like the game, it's cute. Though I am not over the moon about it as there are quite a few things that could very well be improved upon.

It's really fun and I got addicted quickly. I thank the people who made the game for giving you a notifaction of when you have played for an hour straight, otherwise I'd probably be very sleepy all the time!

What is the best part if this game you ask? It's the community. Yes I said community. The community on this game is very fun, weird, but supportive. Just sprinkle in some edgy people and there you have it. The game itself requires dedication. For example I don't play for a week and my best BPM drops by like 15. The end

Fun casual game , if you ignore the age of the game , it's clearly an old one , but can be enjoyed with the right people. :) Has a few annoying things to it but you get used to avoiding them soon.  Would recommend if you're looking for new people to hang out with :)

8/10 Needs more game modes. Okay so this is an serious review.   The first hour: Me downloading, takes 14 seconds. Install and enter, make a character. He needs to look like a total fruit. (You guys seen the game.. its fruity) Click Random Room and load in....  You spawn in with 4-7 other people, all under 16 years old. All fruits or girls. Or Fruity girls. Trash talk them and make them cry for 5 mins before the game starts.  Dance dance dance.  Get 20.000 points when the kids get well over a million.  Get all your grown up friends to get the game.  Make a dance squad.  Have a good one hour laugh.  Play no other game, ever ever ever.

I hate to say it but the game is actually ok. The mechanics work but are gameplay wise pretty repetitive, there are a few game modes to mix things up, guilds which offer bonuses when playing with friends, a pretty unobtrusive cash shop (items are 'buy for a certain time only' though, wtf) and quite a lot of songs, most of which are from the 'I'm a tween!' section but thankfully not all. The only thing reaaaally lacking is graphics options and the technical side overall.  Windowed Mode recommended , else the game looks like ♥♥♥♥. Native controller support would’ve been nice as well, I ♥♥♥♥ing suck at rhythm games that are Keyboard only.

people like to give this game lots of crap, but for stupid reasons.   1 - yes, you CAN use beats (the free in-game currency) to buy things, but when you visit the store you need to adjust the settings so you can see said items  2 - gee, soooo sorry you don't recognise the songs. //sarcasm  but, of course this game isn't perfect. the graphics aren't that great, and it IS quite stupid that things you buy with REAL MONEY are temporary. i made the mistake of putting in my money before realizing this fact.  TLDR; give this poor game a break, it isn't as bad as everyone makes it out to be.

I uninstalled this game within the first 10 minutes. -Songlist: I had no idea/ heard of these songs -Graphics: It's blurry and awful. -Controls: Mehhh...  My recommendation: If you like Kpop/Jpop/mandopop + Anime style characters + Dressing up yourself, play Touch Online by 3Claws, it's like Lovebeat but better!   Theres 3 modes, two of them are similar to Project Diva and Audition. Game is based in Indonesia, but available in the NA. Translation is kinda funky but you get use to how currency works.

This is a very simple rhythm game that had no long-lasting playablilty; the list of songs was very short, and the actual gameplay was very unimpressive. The graphical user interface was very poor, and i was unable to tell where my friends list was (it was not connected to the steam friends list by the way), and joining a friends room was impossible because of the difficulty in navigating the GUI. I would not recommend this game to anybody who wants to play a decent rhythm game.
This game....is cancer....

If you are a weeb and you wanna play something like this try 'Touch'. There are only K-POP/J-POP songs and it has better graphics than LoveBeat. This game has not so many songs and I didn't heard about them untill now and it's like wtf.  BUT WAIT THAT IS NOT ALL.  ARE YOU A BEGINNER,RIGHT?  Then you will have fun with the 999999999999999999 ⋆⋆⋆ impossible and unheard songs!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Conclusion: LoveBeat is somehow a copy of the game Touch. The only difference? The controls, of course. You must be very careful and very fast. The difficulty of each song is dissapointing becasue the beginner player could be actually confused like „what is this dude?”. OH AND I FORGOT ABOUT MY ASIAN FRIENDS LY ALL ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. But I still do not recommend this game.
